label.value: Controls how accurately numbers are stored in the resulting output. A smaller number reduces output size and accuracy.
Controls which symbols will be expanded in the output. 'None' results in the smallest output size, 'All' results in the largest file but has potential performance benefits.
'Once Used' will only expand symbols which are only used once and is the recommended setting.
Controls how the output looks when it is not being animated, this doesn't apply to auto-playing looping animations.
Whether matrix transforms should be applied into all child paths.
Whether repeating bitmaps should be exported as reused symbols.
Should every frame be exported in tweens or just keyframes. Sometimes this can help the animations match those in flash more accurately.
When checked any easing between frames is turned off, resulting in an animation matching the FPS listed in flash.
Will attempt to seemlessly animate the end of a tween back into it's beginning. Only applies when Fixed FPS is not being used.
